result.execSummary:
The defendant Kavin K Nesbit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kavin K Nesbit is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kavin K Nesbit was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Cash bond posted shall be applied to costs.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Spend 9 months in the county jail w/huber and work crew privileges.  To commence 8/1/15 @ 8am.  Credit for 12 days served.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: Huber and work crew privileges are authorized.  Credit for 12 days served.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

superMiscConds.notes: May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, Kavin K Nesbit, appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.   Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 4 years with conditions.  As a condition court imposes 9 months in the KCJ commencing on 8/1/15 at 8:00 AM.  Huber & Work Crew privileges are authorized.  Motion to stay sentence pending an appeal is denied by the court.  Cash Bond on deposit to be applied to costs and surcharges and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared specially for ADA Graveley and for the State.  Defendant, Kavin K Nesbit, appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: PT
Atty Komp requests sentencing be adjourned as DE resides in Milwaukee and needs additional time to go over PSI with DE; no objection by the State.  Sentencing adj. to 7/23/15 at 11:30 AM.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Angela Komp.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found gulty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 6/18/15 at 11:00.  Bond continued.  Notice given to defendant to submit DNA sample.
Final pre-trial on April 17, 2015 at 10:50 am cofirmed with Atty Komp & Atty Graveley
Due to courts unavailability today; FPT to be rescheduled with notice to parties.
Exhibit 1 inventoried and stored in Br 1 Exhibit room on 03-30-15 -   jt
Information regarding frisking a suspect.

Attorney Mike Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, Kavin K Nesbit, appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: PT
State Trooper Fowles is sworn in and testified.  Exhibit 1 is received.  Upon hearing testimony and arguments court denies motion to suppress.  FPT on 3/19/15 at 10:20 AM.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, Kavin K Nesbit, appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: PT
Atty Komp states she is no longer raising competency at this time and parties mutually request a new motion date.  Motion Hearing on 2/26/15 at 1:45 PM.
Motion Hearing changed to a Status Conf. per email correspondence received from Atty Komp and ADA Gravely.
Email from Atty Angela Komp to Paula Trossen.
FPT removed on 12/12/14 and motion to suppress scheduled 1/13 at 2:00 PM.
to Suppress filed by Atty Komp
